intro: Hieracium campylopodum, commonly known as the bent-stem hawkweed, is a flowering plant native to Europe and parts of Asia. It belongs to the family Asteraceae, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in meadows, grasslands, and disturbed soils, reaching heights of up to 60 centimeters. Its leaves are lance-shaped and often have a rough texture, while the flowers are yellow and arranged in a composite head. Hieracium campylopodum is an herbaceous perennial that can spread through both seeds and rhizomes.
